Pisi now internally uses XZ as the default compression algorithm.
Binary package names now reflects the architecture and the distribution release for which the package is built.
Various speed enhancements has been done in the core components for a better package management experience.

Kernel - The Linux kernel shipped with &DISTRONAME; &PRODVER; is &KERNELVER; which is the latest kernel branch which will be supported for a long term period.
Plymouth - The bootsplash technology used in &DISTRONAME; &PRODVER; is the brand new Plymouth engine.
Python - Python &PYTHONVER; is the default Python interpreter in &DISTRONAME; &PRODVER;.
Perl - Perl &PERLVER; is the default Perl interpreter in &DISTRONAME; &PRODVER;.
X.org - The shipped xorg-server version is &XORGVER;, improvements to the automatic driver configuration mechanism has been done by our developers.
Web servers - &DISTRONAME; &PRODVER; ships both Apache &APACHEVER; and NGINX &NGINXVER; HTTP daemon alternatives.
Databases - MySQL &MYSQLVER;, PostgreSQL &POSTGRESQLVER;, BerkeleyDB &BDDBVER; and SqLite &SQLITEVER; are among the DBMS alternatives offered in &DISTRONAME; &PRODVER;.
Mail Servers - Postfix &POSTFIXVER; and Dovecot &DOVECOTVER; are the mail server daemon softwares offered within &DISTRONAME; &PRODVER;.

section.title: Visual Enhancements
section.para: The default icon theme of &DISTRONAME; &PRODVER; is BC Tango which is a Tango derivative specially customized for KDE desktop environment.

section.title: Network Management
section.para: &DISTRONAME; &PRODVER; uses GNOME NetworkManager as the default networking backend.

With the GNOME networking backend, users are able to easily set up their Ethernet (With support for 802.1x authentication), 802.11 Wireless (With support for WEP/WPA/WPA2/WPA-EAP and 802.1x authentication), EDGE/3G/CDMA and VPN networks.

section.title: Office Suite
section.para: LibreOffice, an Open Source personal productivity suite sponsored by the Document Foundation, is the default Office Suite in &DISTRONAME; &PRODVER;.
